Small-circles around Euler pole

Source: R/draw_eulerpole.R
eulerpole_smallcircles.Rd

Construct a line that has a constant distance to the Euler pole.

Usage

eulerpole_smallcircles(x, sm, sf = TRUE)

Arguments

x

data.frame containing coordinates of Euler pole in lat, lon, and rotation angle (optional)

sm

numeric, angle between small circles (in degree); default: 10

sf

logical. Export object type of the lines. TRUE (the default) simple feature (sf) objects. FALSE for "SpatialLInesDataFrame" object.

Value

An object of class sf or SpatialLinesDataFrame

Details

if angle is given: output additionally gives absolute velocity on small circle (degree/Myr -> km/Myr)

Author

Tobias Stephan

Examples

data("nuvel1")
euler <- subset(nuvel1, nuvel1$ID == "na") # North America relative to
euler$angle <- euler$rate
# Pacific plate
eulerpole_smallcircles(euler)
